intro: [WRONG START] Embilia vaupelii, commonly known as the West African embelia, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and disturbed areas. The leaves and fruits are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
